meanings.definition: Resembling glass in transparency or smoothness.
meanings.sent1: The lake looked glassy under the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: Her eyes were glassy with tears.
meanings.sent3: The glassy surface of the pond made it hard to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper's glassy facade reflected the city lights at night.
meanings.sent5: The glassy ice glistened in the winter sunlight.

meanings.sent1: His face remained glassy throughout the entire meeting.
meanings.sent2: The actor's performance felt glassy and unconvincing.
meanings.sent3: The glassy stare of the mannequin gave her the creeps.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded glassy, devoid of any real feeling.
meanings.sent5: The glassy mask she wore hid her true emotions.

meanings.sent1: The glassy vase shattered when it fell off the table.
meanings.sent2: The glassy windows reflected the setting sun.
meanings.sent3: The glassy ornaments on the Christmas tree sparkled beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The glassy chandelier hung elegantly from the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The glassy figurine stood delicately on the shelf.
